nodes.bodyText: I think we should use vespalib::Array instead as that uses the vespalib::AutoAllocator as default. This will for instance use mmapping if allocated size is large.

nodes.bodyText: Also consider changing to a class and hide member variables if this is ever to be used directly. Reference to Mark and curval can be exposed via functions for ReusableSetHandle, or ReusableSetHandle can call mark() and is_marked() directly if we don't think the indirection to be a problem.

+

+
+#include <vector>

+

+
+struct ReusableSet

nodes.bodyText: To match interface of ReusableSet we should use size_t.
To match interface of ReusableSet we should use size_t.
Consider providing the tuning parameters in the constructor and create another constructor that sets the defaults. Also easier to change in for instance unit test if needed.
I think we should have another simple test that test that mark(x) -> is_marked(x) is true for that particular id.
Please add function that returns vespalib::MemoryUsage, which makes it easier to integrate in other components.
Consider using EXPECT_LT(), which will give better error message if it fails.
Consider using EXPECT_GT(), which will give better error message if it fails.
